node.title: She Interviews Celebrities Before School. And Sheâ€™s Only 11.
node.description: Jazlyn Guerra, who goes by Jazzy, has bantered with Alicia Keys, Tom Holland and Jay-Z.
node.content: ["Name: Jazlyn Guerra", "Age: 11", "Hometown: Brooklyn and Col\u00f3n, Panama", "Now Lives: In an apartment in the Bushwick section of Brooklyn with her mother, father and four siblings.", "Claim to Fame: Ms. Guerra, who is known to her fans as Jazzy, is a self-styled \u201ckid reporter\u201d who has scored interviews with celebrities including Alicia Keys, Tom Holland and Denzel Washington. Her spunky on-the-street interviews are posted on her \u201cJazzys World TV\u201d social media channels, which include Instagram (about 76,700 followers), TikTok (about 114,500) and YouTube (about 24,000.) She once asked the soccer player David Beckham \u201cthe most hilarious thing\u201d he\u2019s done as a father (dressing up as the Easter bunny for his children) and the basketball player Carmelo Anthony his \u201cbiggest pet peeve\u201d (being woken up while sleeping). \u201cI think that it\u2019s really cool how they take time out of their busy schedule and out of their busy day just to talk to an 11-year-old little kid,\u201d she said.", "Big Break: When she was 9, her father, Luis De Hoyos, a social worker, took her to various meet and greets to get autographs from athletes. She would ask them questions about their careers and struck up an easy rapport. She and her father decided to start a YouTube show, with her father filming and editing the videos. Her first interview was Gregg Popovich, the head coach for the San Antonio Spurs, before their game against the New York Knicks at Madison Square Garden. She declined to share how she snags her subjects (\u201cIt\u2019s my secret recipe\u201d) but hinted that it involved waiting for hours, including early mornings before school.", "Latest Project: In November, Ms. Guerra interviewed Jay-Z outside his Manhattan office for about two minutes and asked him what it takes to be successful. \u201cBelieve in yourself, even before anyone else believes in you,\u201d Jay-Z said, adding: \u201cYou got to have ultimate confidence, like you do. You\u2019re very confident.\u201d The video garnered hundreds of thousands of views on YouTube and Instagram and was shared widely on Twitter. \u201cIt helped catapult her career and what she\u2019s doing,\u201d Mr. De Hoyos said. \u201cShe\u2019s really, really grateful.\u201d", "Next Thing: Ms. Guerra will be a presenter for Nike Playlist for Kids, a YouTube series where children and professional athletes play active games and sports.", "Down Time: Ms. Guerra is a sixth-grader at a Brooklyn public school, and some of her former teachers have commented on her videos. \u201cJazzy told me her classmates are recognizing her in school,\u201d Mr. De Hoyos said, adding that she was recently invited to sit with the 7th and 8th graders at lunch. She also likes to play video games, including Madden NFL and Fortnite, and hang out with friends. She has recently become a fan of watching boxing and is starting to train as well. \u201cI\u2019m learning more about the sport,\u201d she said. \u201cI think I want to interview more boxers in the future, just to get some tips.\u201d"]
